original_title: The Off-Handed Jape... & How to Pull It Off
overview: The Off-Handed Jape is an afternoon’s lark made by Nelson and his artist friend William Wiley. The two men perform whimsical actions and poses for the camera, then recontextualize this imagery by improvising their own commentary on the action at a later time. —Andy Ditzler
title: The Off-Handed Jape... & How to Pull It Off
